text: lamb leg has a fairly complicated bone
structure I mean there's an e in there
but the incredible thing is it only
takes three cuts to take apart a leg of
lamb
here's your cooked leg of lamb they all
look pretty much like this or they
should this is the shank which is you
might think of as the ankle the part
that attaches to the foot and this is
the thigh the meteor side is rounder and
plumper and that's the side you wanna
it'll pretty much sit flat on the back
side and what you're gonna do is take as
big a slice as you can parallel to this
bone and then we're gonna cut off the
side chunks it's actually not unlike
what you do with the turkey you want to
take the biggest pieces you can off the
bone and then slice them the way to do
that which I'm gonna have to show you is
to just put the knife through there if
you feel resistance the bone is always
gonna be underneath the knife you move
the knife up a little bit you can use a
boning knife for this you use a chef's
knife for this or you can use what
amounts to a bread knife for this it's a
nice tool because it's almost always
sharp and it's good at making big gross
cuts which this first cut is so here we
go
right against the bone with the blade
and then you're almost immediately gonna
feel some resistance come up into the
meat and then against the bone as best
you can if and when you encounter
resistance like right here move the
knife up get over that little piece back
down and there is a beautiful first cut
now what you've done is taken that top
layer off and you've got two big pieces
along each side of the main bone here
I'd switch to a boning knife could use a
chef's knife also now you can pretty
much see where the bone is cut right
along that joint turn this around if you
need to bear in mind that I'm
left-handed so I'm doing everything
backwards as far as most of you are
concerned and again just cut right along
the bone if you feel resistance move the
blade away from the bone
you'll find that joint now three
beautiful big pieces of lamb so now
you're slicing however you want to
diagonally straight down
whatever great thing about leg of lamb
this is almost always true is that it's
not gonna cook uniformly so people who
want rare are gonna get rare so mean you
don't overcook it people who want
well-done can get well-done you're gonna
have different shapes and sizes of
slices I like their that crunch you can
be as compulsive as you like about
slicing this I'd go for half inch thick
or even slightly wider slices so to
reiterate the sort of main points you
want to get these three big pieces off
the leg which is really pretty easy as
you saw to is don't expect uniformity
that's kind of what leg of lamb is about
finally don't forget about the meat that
you've left on the bone and when you're
done eating go back and attack that with
a small knife and get some pieces off of
there and that's what I'm gonna do now
